title: Qiyana: Awesome visuals, but one big missed opportunity.
body:
Based on the image below, Qiyana's pretty awesome -- her weapon and outfit and jewelry really sell her region's aesthetic, and her pose lets you know she barely has time to show you her disdain for you. The design team knocked most of this out of the park.

https://cdn.upcomer.com/esports/__sized__/content/4234-qiyana-crop-c0-5__0-5-780x312.png

...but then we get to her hair. We have what *appears* to be the empress of a region that seems inspired by meso-american culture to at least some extent, and given how different that is from anything else we've seen in Runeterra it feels like a great opportunity to show us that by making a character whose hair and makeup styles reflect that cultural difference. Instead, we have another female character with white, flowing, slightly curled hair and a classical western tiara-style crown.

Now, I have nothing against that, but I feel it's a missed opportunity to tell us something about this new region. Compare to Illaoi, who sells her culture through her unusual earrings, makeup, and hairstyle, causing her face to very clearly reflect her character and her origin.

If we zoom in on Qiyana, we can basically call her a somewhat generic Runeterra woman. Probably a princess or a queen, sure, but for someone who is introducing a new region and is -- further -- the *leader* of said region, does this really live up to that representation?

https://imgur.com/LgWG5mD

Compare that to how unique taking inspiration from, say, any of this traditional Mayan (or African, or Egyptian, we there are some elements of those in the design as well) hairstyles would be -- and there are certainly more cultures you could pull from. She obviously needs a hairstyle that's unique to *her* culture and not a real-world culture, but I feel there's untapped ground here to showcase who she and her people are.

https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/f80d065e-d050-421a-ad5b-e89bd87af73a/d7v1kth-1579e8d7-97a5-4aa0-8142-744d1be88307.jpg/v1/fill/w_1024,h_3982,q_75,strp/maya_women_hairstyles_of_the_classic_period_by_kamazotz_d7v1kth-fullview.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..tX-M51hNubSa3kfF1a8CdmwQL56cn2bTz6Cujdz9NFU

replies.body:
I also felt like her hair really missed the mark. It's not just the style to me either, it's the platinum silver color.

Qiyana isn't selling me "jungle queen of a secret society of shamans." She's selling me "Lady Gaga in the Jungle."
It looks like all of the people in her roadmap teaser have that hair color. Not to make excuses, though, but at least it seems there's an aesthetic going on.

> [{quoted}](name=Cetri,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-06-06T19:37:50.171+0000)
>
> It looks like all of the people in her roadmap teaser have that hair color. Not to make excuses, though, but at least it seems there's an aesthetic going on.

And that's fine. The color doesn't bother me so much as the loss of a chance to use her head -- the most expressive part of the champion -- to sell this new culture.

Don't invoke thy name...you'll start a Bad Romance montage...
Rah rah, rah rah rahhhh, romaaa romamaaa :)
Are you sure Lady Gaga ISN'T the jungle queen of a secret society of shamans?

Isn't she one of the Egyptian Gods?

"No, Pharaoh."

Well, she should be...

I didnt like it until i read that last line.

Now i love it.
_is this a personal attack or something?_

> [{quoted}](name=Garen is adopted,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-06T19:20:51.927+0000)_is this a personal attack or something?_

Nope. Love the design, and the artists did a great job. I simply think there was a missed opportunity to really make this character feel like she and her region have a unique place in Runeterra.

Can I speak brutally honest?

Her Hairstyle and eyes make her look like a snobby, entitled late teenager. You know, the ones who always are chewing bubblegun and have pink purses.

That said, maybe that is presicely, and intentionally, done so. We have had many regions in Runeterra so far, but even demacia is not borderline arrogant. Maybe this is a first glimpse on a Runeterran culture doing precisely that. Being Stuck up know-it-alls. The arrogant folk in the world. 

It would on one end mean another grey-area populus, but on the other hand, one so distinctively and clearly defined, yet so stereotypical at the same time that it's something new again.

Why can't we get a bald woman in the game? Like does every woman have to have a magnificent chevelure?

I'd root for a tribe full of baldies lol

I think this works for her a lot better than the platinum color.

I know she only just got revealed, but the design of her weapon looks stolen wholesale from Tira of Soulcalibur.

Here's an image for comparison. 

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/soulcalibur/images/0/0d/SC6_Tira.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180821102334

Then we look at Qiyana.

https://cdn.upcomer.com/esports/__sized__/content/4234-qiyana-crop-c0-5__0-5-780x312.png

It's just that since I've played all the Soulcalibur games, and seen Tira in action many times, I can't help but notice the similarity.

I'm sure as more gets revealed about Qiyana the similarities will lessen, but as it currently stands, well... yeah.

I'm personally not too worried about that. The chakram is a popular weapon in fantasy art, and a giant one is not that unique.
Issue here being, "giant chakram" is a really old concept that probably predates Tira by many decades.
Kind of sad shes not older either, she looks like a teenager. I hope it's not something again like Zoe and Neeko where they are super old but act/are children.

Don't understand why this is being downvoted. The bad ass old woman theme in other games is so interesting. Just imagine how bad ass would an old war-torn female fighter would be. There's currently none of that in league. You could kind of say Camille, but she doesn't visual stand out as that. 

Literally all the recent female champions (other than Yuumi, shes just a cat) have been from like 10-20, there's really no diversity in that.
does not matter to me. she has white hair so what. she is not supposed to 100 percent portray a culture

> [{quoted}](name=TheMan292,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2019-06-06T20:30:59.502+0000)
>
> does not matter to me. she has white hair so what. she is not supposed to 100 percent portray a culture

Totally fine. The current design might work perfectly for you, in which case that's awesome! I'm not super concerned about the hair color myself -- the stylistic choice of the hairstyle and the crown element are what I have more reservations about.

The problem is that gold is everyone in every single region. And golden jewelry with some green gemstone doesn't feel like some old hidden cilivization. And the outfit all together doesn't hit the unique culture it wants to be. And the hair is just Riot obsessing over white hair, and it's starting to ruining their products.

> [{quoted}](name=Camille Ferrøs,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-06-06T19:52:08.933+0000)The problem is that gold is everyone in every single region. And golden jewelry with some green gemstone doesn't feel like some old hidden cilivization. 

You can do a lot with gold and green though. You could use Egyptian, Mayan, or African crowns. You could mix it with fabric or feathers. You could substitute jade for the gems, or use settings more inspiration by non-western designs.

Dark skin, white hair, control of the elements: Ororo Munroe, probably.
 But, in the end, she's only another  stripper from Las Vegas in a fantasy costume, like almost every other girl in this game.
I look at her  and her design.....and I see Princess Peach

I'm the complete opposite: I think her head is fine. From the neck down she's just this play-it-safe-generic "girl clothes" champ. There's nothing about her interesting save for her weapon and her head.

Hell, you could even go further into the sexy territory and just own up to it with some big amazonian tribal clothing or some more revealing psuedo-meso-america clothing. What we instead get is the personification of Oatmeal who looks more like a Season 2 design than a Season 9 design in a very bad way.

> Compare to Illaoi, who sells her culture through her unusual earrings, makeup, and hairstyle, causing her face to very clearly reflect her character and her origin.

Personally, I feel the difference between Illaoi and Qiyana from a design standpoint is that Illaoi wasn't meant to be attractive. That isn't to say Illaoi is unattractive, but she's a tall, beefy, powerful woman that went far and away thematically from the Syndras and Jannas of Runeterra. As such, they had a bit more liberty to make her different because her selling point wasn't "she's hot".

Unfortunately, it seems, whenever the goal of a character is more leaning toward sex appeal, the less there is room for "different". Jinx is honestly still their biggest accomplishment on that front.

Illaoi still isn't all that popular despite really fun visual effects and a rich character. That being said, I don't think Riot NEEDS every character to be popular these days. A lot of people have played this game for years and are set in their mains, it's much more likely to make me budge off Lux if there is a niche character I really identify with over another wide-appealing character that has me saying not much more than "oh look, a new champion".
{{sticker:sg-jinx}} gimme this champ now

The hair and face just ruins the whole character to me. YAAAAWN another generic {{champion:15}}.

Because {{champion:22}} League {{champion:145}} didn’t {{champion:92}} already {{champion:40}} have {{champion:164}} any {{champion:127}} characters {{champion:113}} matching {{champion:69}} this {{champion:131}} one {{champion:84}} in {{champion:39}} personality {{champion:114}} or {{champion:10}} aesthetic.

If you want to see unique and interesting character done RIGHT, look at {{champion:164}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:518}}.

I’m sad to be so negative but this champion has NOTHING to make you go “i relate to this and want to play it.” She’ll be rolling off her gameplay alone.

As a woman of Colour I'm pretty underwhelmed lmao.

Personally I would have loved to see her have a wider nose.

^^^^

Wider nose, hips, lips, and not that damn wig looking like she stole Sharon Needles wig do that she could lip sync for her life. 

I just can't get over that ugly ass wig!
I like her hair - this is a fantasy game, it does not have to be so deeply rooted in any specific source material.
Thing is, Riot's trying to make League more realistic.

> [{quoted}](name=Raxistaicho,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=00210000,timestamp=2019-06-07T03:27:57.120+0000)
>
> Thing is, Riot's trying to make League more realistic.

It is?
Yeah the hair also kinda seemed a bit odd to me when you look at the rest of her design..
Is Riot going back to the days of monthly champ releases?/ one champ per couple months? Cus it feels like they're pumping out as many reworks and champs as they can.

> [{quoted}](name=14daysuspensionk,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Woij1lcE,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2019-06-06T20:26:41.883+0000)
>
> Is Riot going back to the days of monthly champ releases?/ one champ per couple months? Cus it feels like they're pumping out as many reworks and champs as they can.

Totally agree, It feels like Sylas Yuumi and Qiyana will be released with very low intervals. Although that would explain why Yuumi is still a champion concept more than a complete champion, the work could've been sped up (don't know if it's correct) in order to hop on the next champion before the job on Yuumi was even finished. Hell, she's a support but the most efficient way I've found to play her is as a crit ADC with Hail of blades
